name: Person-People-GET-getPersonalInformation
description: [Person] GET /people/{ID}/personalInformation — Retrieves a collection of personal information.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: country
schema.description: Specifies the set of personal information by country that will be returned. If empty, the most recently updated set of personal information will be returned.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: primaryOnly

schema.description: If true, returns only the IDs of the person's public web addresses.

schema.name: usedFor
schema.description:
Specifies usage behavior, such as mailing, billing, or shipping.
Optional.

name: Person-Countries-GET-getAddressComponents
description:
[Person] GET /countries/{ID}/addressComponents — Retrieves the allowed address components and their configuration for the Country and a given Address Configuration Format.
The webServiceAlias of the returned address components map to the enterable fields when submitting address data in other POST/PUT/PATCH operations.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: addressConfigurationFormat
schema.description:
The Address Configuration Format to return values for. 
Required. Failure to provide this will result in no address components being returned.
Available values are:
- DEFAULT_AREAS
- RECRUITING_FORMAT

schema.name: currentAddress
schema.description:
The existing address being updated. 
Required when you use Default Format and a Country using Local Script to get component data for an existing address. Failure to provide this when appropriate may result in incorrect address component data being returned.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: useWesternScript
schema.description: When applicable, setting this value to false will enable Local Script components only. Local Components that are requireable will be enforced as required.  When set to true, Local Script and Western Script components are enabled. Western Script Components that are requireable will be enforced as required.

name: Person-Countries-GET-getNameComponents
description: [Person] GET /countries/{ID}/nameComponents — Retrieves a collection of configuration information about name components.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: currentName
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the person's current name being updated. 
Required when you use Default Format and a Country using Local Script to get component data for an existing name. Failure to provide this when appropriate may result in incorrect name component data being returned.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: nameConfigurationFormat
schema.description:
The Name Configuration Format for which to return values. 
Required. Failure to provide this will result in no name components being returned.
Available values are:
- RECRUITING_FORMAT - The name components specific to Recruiting.
- OTHER_FUNCTIONAL_AREAS - The name components for all other functional areas in Workday.
Example: nameConfigurationFormat=Name_Configuration_Format_ID=OTHER_FUNCTIONAL_AREAS

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: useWesternScript
schema.description: When applicable, setting this value to false will enable Local Script components only. Local Components that are requireable will be enforced as required.  When set to true, Local Script and Western Script components are enabled. Western Script Components that are requireable will be enforced as required.

schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: primaryOnly
schema.description: If true, returns only the IDs of the person's primary web addresses.

schema.name: publicOnly
schema.description: If true, returns only the IDs of the person's public web addresses.

schema.name: usageType
schema.description: Specifies usage type, such as home or work. Only used if the service provides access to multiple usage types from the same endpoint.

schema.name: usedFor
schema.description:
Specifies usage behavior, such as mailing, billing, or shipping.
Optional.
